comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Captured flying among cumulo nimbus cloud at an unknown angle and firing a 5 inch unguided ‘Zuni’ rocket, is seen……. Vought F-8D Crusader 147056 Modex 452 tail code NE of Carrier Air Wing Two (CVW-2). Sharkmouth decoration of VF-111 ‘Sundowners’ around air intake and fierce eye markings on side of nose. Blackened 20 millimeter cannon port surrounds. Twin Zuni 5 inch unguided air-to-surface rocket packs on both upper and lower fuselage pylons for Close Air Support missions. Label on bottom left side of image reads; “F8C FIRES MISSILE GROUND SUPPORT VIETNAM” This excellent website and its webpages is an aid to identify units or deployments: www.gonavy.jp/index.html ‘GO!NAVY’ (courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) And this web page: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NEf.html records that F-8D equipped VF-111 ‘Sundowners’ using Modex codes in the 451-462 range, was part of CVW-2 code NE assigned to CVA-41 USS Midway from March 6 to November 23 1965 on a Vietnam War deployment to the South China Sea and Tonkin Gulf. The Vought F8U-2N Crusader was redesignated F-8D in 1962. Info on Vought F8U-2N Crusader courtesy of Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago, Illinois: www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_6.html 1963 picture of F-8D 147056 with VF-111: (scroll down to page 101 using slider bar on right of PDF document with download option) es.scribd.com/doc/60152224/Vought-s-F-8-Crusader-Navy-Fig... VF-111 F-8D 147056 on 12-20-63 with the F-8D 1479056 was one of 89 F-8D uprated to F-8H: www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_11.html (courtesy of Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago, Illinois) F-8H Crusader 147056 is recorded with VF-111 ‘Sundowners’ as Modex 110 when part of 6th Fleet Atlantic coast based CVW-8 aboard CVS-38 USS Shangri La for a very long Vietnam War deployment from March 5 to December 17 1970 www.gonavy.jp/index.html ‘GO!NAVY’ www.gonavy.jp/CVW-AJf.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW8-AJ1970.html (info courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan) Based at NAS Miramar, California, after early involvement in the Vietnam War VF-111s F-8Ds were replaced by F-8Cs from November 1965, these were soon replaced by F-8Es, when VF-111 again sailed for Vietnam in May 1966 it had a full complement of E-model Crusaders. After the squadron returned from this cruise it reverted back to the F-8C in late 1966 or early 1967. These were then changed for the uprated F-8H version. The squadron made seven deployments to southeast Asia. F-8P 147056 was one of 35 F-8H sold to the Republic of the Philippines and still survives. In late 1977, the Philippine government purchased 35 ex US Navy F-8Hs stored at MASDC in Arizona. Twenty-five were refurbished by Vought and remaining 10 used for spares. Operational until January 1988, most of the remainder were placed in open storage at Basa Air Base. Stored airframes were damaged beyond use on 15 June 1991 by Mount Pinatubo eruption and eventually sold as scrap. F-8P Crusader 147056 (c/n 99) Philippine Air Force serial number 47056/313 is on display (as 147056) outdoors at Philippine Air Force Museum, Villamor Air Base, Ninoy Aquino International Airport. Pasay City, Republic of the Philippines: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Vought_F-8_Crusader_PAF.jpg jetphotos.net/viewphoto.php?id=6042685&nseq=3
